page.title: 18THE CHURCH AT THORPE END
page.content: Thorpe End church is called St. Davids. It was built in 1955 and opened on 1st October. The{church}is built of brick and there is a{plaque near the door saying "This stone was laid by Mrs. A. M. Kirby". The vicar of the church is Rev. Hilton Francis. There is a service every week. Every 3rd week there is a family service. The other two weeks there is family communion at 9a.m. During the week the church is used as a hall for village{activies}such as parties, meetings etc. and in the past for a youth club. At the back of the church there is a field which the church rents to a local farmer. The church is Church of England. St. Davids is also in the same{parish as Great Plumstead and Little Plumstead.
